abstract: Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney operated as clergyman, organizer and defender of the Mormon faith from 1981 through 1994, guiding the church in Boston through a tumultuous period of rapid growth; facing a primary electorate in which Christian conservatives are a powerful force, Romney is trying to keep his religion from becoming a barrier to his election. (Series: The Long Run)
